required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Sufentanil Sublingual Microtablet 30 mcg and 15 mcg in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Sufentanil Sublingual Microtablet 30 mcg and 15 mcg in Healthy Subjects

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to establish the single and multiple-dose pharmacokinetics (PK) of sublingual administration of the Sufentanil Sublingual Microtablet (SSM) 30 mcg and compare the pharmacokinetics of a single dose of SSM 30 mcg to 2 doses of SSM 15 mcg administered 20 minutes apart.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.time_frame: 9 days, not including a 30 day screening window
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time curve

other_outcome.description: Time to reach maximum plasma concentration

arm_group.description: Sufenta® IV (50 mcg/mL) 30 mcg infused over 1 minute

arm_group.arm_group_label: Treatment C: 2 consecutive doses of SSM 15 mcg
arm_group.description: 2 consecutive doses of SSM 15 mcg administered 20 minute apart
12 consecutive doses of SSM 30 mcg administered 1 hour apart

intervention.intervention_name: Treatment C: 2 consecutive doses of SSM 15 mcg administered 20 minutes apart
intervention.arm_group_label: Treatment C: 2 consecutive doses of SSM 15 mcg

intervention.description: 12 consecutive doses of SSM 30 mcg administered 1 hour apart

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Non-smoking male or female subjects
2. Aged between 18 and 45 years inclusive
3. Subjects must have Body Mass Index (BMI) between 18 and 30, inclusively.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects who are taking over-the-counter medication (except for single dose multi-vitamin supplements or acetaminophen of less than 2 g/day) within 14 days prior to start of sufentanil dosing prescription medications or over the counter (OTC) medications
2. Female subjects who are pregnant
3. Subjects with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, sleep apnea, or other significant respiratory disorders
